result.eng: Sing a song!
result.ga: Abair amhrán
result.orig: Abair amhrán
result.html: Abair amhránSing a song!

result.eng: Assuming he is right, where does that leave us?

result.eng: Can I talk to you now? - Okay, go ahead.

result.eng: First of all, I must say that I am innocent.
result.ga: Ar an chéad dul síos caithfidh mé a rá go bhfuil mé neamhchiontach

result.eng: On Thomas's advice it was agreed not to say anything to the media.
result.ga: Ar chomhairle Thomáis aontaíodh gan aon rud a rá leis na meáin

result.eng: When he was leaving, Fionn said he would be back.
result.ga: Ar imeacht dó dúirt Fionn go mbeadh sé ar ais

result.eng: I just said that for fun.
result.ga: Ar mhaithe le greann a dúirt mé sin

result.html: Ar mhaithe le greann a dúirt mé sinI just said that for fun.
result.ponchtml: Ar ṁaiṫe le greann a dúirt mé sinI just said that for fun.

result.eng: I would like to say something on this matter.

result.eng: I would like to say something about that.

result.html: Ba mhaith liom rud éigin a rá ina thaobh sinI would like to say something about that.

result.eng: I would like to say this very clearly.

result.eng: What does he say when he doesn't have the right answer?

result.eng: What are they saying about us?

result.ponchtml: Cad atá siad ag rá inár dtaoḃWhat are they saying about us?

result.html: Cad atá tú ag ráWhat are you saying?
result.ponchtml: Cad atá tú ag ráWhat are you saying?

result.eng: They put their heads togerther and said that he should be given the prize.
result.ga: Chuir siad a gcomhairlí i dteannta a chéile agus dúirt siad gurbh fhearr an duais a thabhairt dó

result.eng: He tells me he has no money.
result.ga: Deir sé liom nach bhfuil airgead aige
result.orig: Deir sé liom nach bhfuil airgead aige
result.html: Deir sé liom nach bhfuil airgead aigeHe tells me he has no money.

result.ponchtml: Déan mar a deirtear leatDo as you're told!

result.eng: I'd say I had more to drink that he.

result.eng: I told him the price.

result.orig: Dúirt mé an praghas leis
result.html: Dúirt mé an praghas leisI told him the price.
result.ponchtml: Dúirt mé an praġas leisI told him the price.

result.eng: I said to myself that I would get up very early in the morning.

result.eng: She will accept anything you tell her.

result.orig: Glacfaidh sí le rud ar bith a deir tú léi
result.html: Glacfaidh sí le rud ar bith a deir tú léiShe will accept anything you tell her.

result.eng: Thank you very much. - Don't mention it.

result.eng: It doesn't matter what I say, he does his own thing.

result.eng: We'll select a county, say Mayo, and do a documentary about it.

result.eng: I have said enough.
result.ga: Tá dóthain ráite agam

result.ponchtml: Tá dóṫain ráite agamI have said enough.

result.eng: Excuse me. Can you say that again, please?

result.eng: I am trying to say something to you.

result.eng: You're interested in football, right? You could say I am!

result.ponchtml: An ndeir siḃ é sin go minicDo you say that often?

result.eng: They say every group needs somebody to blame.

result.eng: I remember that I often used to say to people...

result.eng: Everybody who was alive in 1963 says they remember exactly the point in time when they heard of President John F. Kennedy's assassination.

result.ponchtml: Deir gaċ éinne a ḃí beo i 1963 gur cuiṁin leo go cruinn ala an ama ar ċuala siad faoi ḋúnṁarú an Uaċtaráin John F KennedyEverybody who was alive in 1963 says they remember exactly the point in time when they heard of President John F. Kennedy's assassination.

result.eng: I wish I had never said that.

result.eng: Some people say the 11 September attacks were only an excuse for America to wage war against the whole world.
result.ga: Táthar ann a deir nach raibh in ionsaithe an 11ú Meán Fomhair ach leithscéal do Mheiriceá cogadh a fhearadh ar an domhan mór

result.eng: It is still the most controversial subject in America, I'd say.

result.eng: I told my neighbour on the plane that I would then be taking the bus to my destination.

result.eng: "Don't do it," the man said.

result.eng: Be sensible and don't say such things.

result.eng: You have the children all confused, if I must say so.

result.eng: They started making fun of Jamie, saying she would be his wife one day.

result.orig: Thoisigh siad a mhagadh ar Sheimí a rá leis gurb í a bheadh mar mhnaoi aige
result.html: Thoisigh siad a mhagadh ar Sheimí a rá leis gurb í a bheadh mar mhnaoi aigeThey started making fun of Jamie, saying she would be his wife one day.
result.ponchtml: Ṫoisiġ siad a ṁagaḋ ar Ṡeimí a rá leis gurb í a ḃeaḋ mar ṁnaoi aigeThey started making fun of Jamie, saying she would be his wife one day.

result.eng: His wife was only dead for a couple of days when people started saying in secret that he was thinking of helping himself to a new one.
result.ga: Ní raibh a bhean marbh ach cupla mí go rabhathas á rá i modh rúin go raibh sé ag smaoineamh ar cheann eile a tharraingt air
result.orig: Ní raibh a bhean marbh ach cupla mí go rabhathas á rá i modh rúin go raibh sé ag smaoineamh ar cheann eile a tharraingt air
result.html: Ní raibh a bhean marbh ach cupla mí go rabhathas á rá i modh rúin go raibh sé ag smaoineamh ar cheann eile a tharraingt airHis wife was only dead for a couple of days when people started saying in secret that he was thinking of helping himself to a new one.
result.ponchtml: Ní raiḃ a ḃean marḃ aċ cupla mí go raḃaṫas á rá i moḋ rúin go raiḃ sé ag smaoineaṁ ar ċeann eile a ṫarraingt airHis wife was only dead for a couple of days when people started saying in secret that he was thinking of helping himself to a new one.
